SEARCH
Package controller.controllerLocation

Class ExitController

java.lang.Object
controller.controllerLocation.ExitController
public class ExitController extends Object
Controller class for managing exits between locations in the game. This class acts as an intermediary between the ExitModel and ExitView. It handles all operations related to exits, including retrieving location names, coordinates, and executing the movement between locations.

  • Constructor Details

    • ExitController

      public ExitController(ExitModel exitModel)
      Constructs a new ExitController with the specified exit model. Initializes the controller with a reference to the exit model and creates a new ExitView that will be managed by this controller.
      Parameters:
      exitModel - the model containing the exit's data

  • Method Details

    • getExitModel

      public ExitModel getExitModel()
      Gets the exit model associated with this controller.
      Returns:
      the ExitModel instance

    • getExitView

      public ExitView getExitView()
      Gets the exit view associated with this controller.
      Returns:
      the ExitView instance

    • getStartLocationName

      public String getStartLocationName()
      Gets the name of the starting location for this exit.
      Returns:
      a string representing the name of the source location

    • getDestinationLocationName

      public String getDestinationLocationName()
      Gets the name of the destination location for this exit.
      Returns:
      a string representing the name of the destination location

    • getStartCoord

      public Point getStartCoord()
      Gets the coordinates of this exit in its source location.
      Returns:
      a Point object containing the exit's coordinates

    • go

      public boolean go()
      Executes a movement through this exit. Creates a GoModel to handle the transition between locations and executes the movement from the current location to the destination location.
      Returns:
      true if the movement was successful, false otherwise
